metadata.description:
This data set contains meteorological observation data of the downstream desert station of heihe hydrometeorological observation network from May 2, 2015 to December 31, 2015. The station is located at the ejin banner desert beach in Inner Mongolia, and the underlying surface is desert.The longitude and latitude of the observation point are 100.9872e, 42.1135n and 1054m above sea level.Air temperature and relative humidity sensors are set at 5m and 10m, facing due north;The barometer is installed at 2m;The tilting bucket rain gauge is installed at 10m;The wind speed sensor is set at 5m and 10m, and the wind direction sensor is set at 10m, facing due north;The four-component radiometer is installed at 6m, facing due south;Two infrared thermometers are installed at 6m, facing due south, and the probe facing vertically downward;The soil temperature probe is buried at 0cm of the surface and 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 60cm and 100cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil water sensor is buried 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 60cm and 100cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil hot plates (3 pieces) are buried 6cm underground.
Observation projects are: air temperature and humidity (Ta_5m RH_5m Ta_10m, RH_10m) (unit: c, percentage), pressure (Press) (unit: hundred mpa), precipitation (Rain) (unit: mm), wind speed (WS_5m, WS_10m) (unit: m/s), wind (WD_10m) (unit: degrees), the radiation of four component (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit: watts per square meter), the surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit:C), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (in watts/m2), soil moisture (Ms_2cm, Ms_4cm, Ms_10cm, Ms_20cm, Ms_40cm, Ms_60cm, Ms_100cm) (unit: volumetric water content, percentage), and soil temperature (Ts_0cm, Ts_2cm, Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_40cm, Ts_60cm, Ts_100cm) (unit: Celsius).
Processing and quality control of observed data :(1) ensure 144 pieces of data every day (every 10min), and mark by -6999 in case of data missing;Soil heat flux 1 data was missing between May 11, 2015 and 6.6 due to sensor problems;(2) excluding the time with duplicate records;(3) data that obviously exceeds the physical significance or the range of the instrument is deleted;(4) the part marked with red letter in the data is the data in question;(5) date and time have the same format, and date and time are in the same column.For example, the time is: June 10, 2015, 10:30;(6) the naming rule is: AWS+ site name.
For information of hydrometeorological network or station, please refer to Li et al. (2013), and for observation data processing, please refer to Liu et al. (2011).

该数据集包含了2015年5月2日至2015年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网下游荒漠站气象要素观测数据，站点位于内蒙古额济纳旗荒漠滩，下垫面是荒漠。观测点的经纬度是100.9872E, 42.1135N，海拔1054m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在5m、10m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在2m处；翻斗式雨量计安装在10m处；风速传感器架设在5m、10m，风向传感器架设在10m，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm和100cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分传感器分别埋设在地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm和100cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_5m、RH_5m、Ta_10m、RH_10m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_5m、WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_60cm、Ms_100cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)和土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_60cm、Ts_100cm）（单位：摄氏度）。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；土壤热通量1由于传感器的问题，在2015.5.11-6.6间数据缺失；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2015-6-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散发（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散发估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散发，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况下。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量值来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈的平流灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完整的情况下，EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间的关系更为复杂。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这通常对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强平流环境也是一个重要因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散量（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观察比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，通过一系列TSEB模型来估算蒸散发（E）、温度（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡度相关（EC）测量，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

衍生组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还因为在灌溉农田中，当平均H较小时，EC系统的不确定性达到了18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括离地5米处的气温、风速和湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用10 Hz采样频率的EC系统在离地4.5米处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，采用Craig–Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的显热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是使用热像仪获得的图像计算的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热成像图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮度温度。最后，热红外温度通过天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率转换为辐射温度。接着，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于蒸散发的比率。这是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的上升尺度是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在层次嵌套的尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而解决这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次密集观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅呈现2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个EC塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了密集观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了LiDAR、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是经济发展的基础，尤其是在中国西部，自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持了中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域已被前期研究发现是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013）、咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度、风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期进行观测，同时还记录了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，其中包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced when collecting multi-scale eco-hydrological data in oasis-desert systems?
Example.QuestionCn: 在收集绿洲-沙漠系统中的多尺度生态水文数据时面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: A challenge in collecting multi-scale eco-hydrological data is the poor availability of multiscale observations. The HiWATER experiment was designed to address this challenge through the use of hierarchically nested scales to obtain comprehensive data from oasis-desert interactions, employing instruments such as eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations across different landscapes.
Example.AnswerCn: 收集多尺度生态水文数据的一个挑战是多尺度观测的可用性较差。HiWATER实验旨在通过使用分层嵌套尺度来解决这一挑战，以获取来自绿洲-沙漠相互作用的综合数据，采用了涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站等仪器，覆盖不同的景观。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the essential characteristics of meteorological sensors used in desert environments for hydrometeorological observations?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 用于沙漠环境的水文气象观测的气象传感器的基本特征是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: air temperature and humidity sensors at 5m and 10m, barometer at 2m, rain gauge at 10m
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 空气温度和湿度传感器在5米和10米处，气压计在2米处，雨量计在10米处。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the distinguishing features of multiscale datasets used in eco-hydrological research within oasis-desert ecosystems?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统的生态水文研究中，多尺度数据集的区别特征是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: data collected from various spatial and temporal scales, flux observation matrices, eco-hydrological sensor networks, hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing, soil moisture, leaf area index, vegetation dynamics, remote sensing data from LiDAR, thermal imagers
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 从不同空间和时间尺度收集的数据、通量观测矩阵、生态水文传感器网络、高分辨率机载遥感、土壤湿度、叶面积指数、植被动态、来自LiDAR的遥感数据、热成像仪。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the primary challenges associated with upscaling eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces using remote sensing data?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 使用遥感数据对异质表面的生态水文过程进行上尺度化的主要挑战是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: poor availability of multiscale observations, complexity of capturing interactions in oasis-desert systems, need for detailed high-resolution data
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测的可用性差，捕捉绿洲-沙漠系统中相互作用的复杂性，需要详细的高分辨率数据。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in data quality control procedures between a hydrometeorological observation network and an eco-hydrological sensor network?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 水文气象观测网络与生态水文传感器网络在数据质量控制程序方面有哪些差异？
Comparison.AnswerEn: In the hydrometeorological observation network, data quality control includes ensuring 144 data points per day, removing duplicate records, and marking questionable data in red. For the eco-hydrological sensor network within HiWATER, data quality control involves sensor calibration, data collection, processing, and dataset generation, emphasizing thorough quality control across multiple stages.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在水文气象观测网络中，数据质量控制包括确保每天144个数据点，去除重复记录，并将可疑数据标记为红色。在HiWATER的生态水文传感器网络中，数据质量控制涉及传感器校准、数据收集、处理和数据集生成，强调在多个阶段进行彻底的质量控制。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the challenges of obtaining multiscale observations in an oasis-desert system compare with those faced in capturing surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中获取多尺度观测的挑战与在强烈对流的灌溉农业区捕捉表面通量所面临的挑战相比，如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: In an oasis-desert system, the challenge lies in the poor availability of multiscale observations, addressed through hierarchical instrumentation. Meanwhile, in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area, challenges include the incomplete energy balance closure and the dominant uncertainty in surface-air temperature differences affecting the TSEB model performance.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，挑战在于多尺度观测的稀缺性，这通过分层仪器来解决。与此同时，在强对流的灌溉农业区，挑战包括能量平衡闭合的不完整性以及影响TSEB模型性能的表面-空气温度差异的主要不确定性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How might the observed patterns in soil temperature and moisture data collected from various depths inform the understanding of subsurface energy exchange processes in desert ecosystems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 从不同深度收集的土壤温度和湿度数据中观察到的模式如何有助于理解沙漠生态系统中的地下能量交换过程？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The dataset provides soil temperature and moisture measurements at multiple depths, which are crucial for understanding subsurface energy exchange processes. These measurements can help interpret how energy is distributed and exchanged between the soil and atmosphere, influencing evapotranspiration and hydrological cycles in desert ecosystems. Such data interpretation can reveal insights into soil heat flux dynamics and the role of subsurface conditions in regulating surface energy balance.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 该数据集提供了多个深度的土壤温度和湿度测量，这对于理解地下能量交换过程至关重要。这些测量可以帮助解释能量如何在土壤和大气之间分布和交换，从而影响沙漠生态系统中的蒸散发和水文循环。这种数据解释可以揭示土壤热通量动态的洞察，以及地下条件在调节表面能量平衡中的作用。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges in accurately estimating surface fluxes in arid regions using the two-source energy balance model?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区使用双源能量平衡模型准确估计表面通量面临的挑战的因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The challenges in accurately estimating surface fluxes in arid regions using the two-source energy balance model are primarily due to the uncertainty in surface-air temperature difference and the strong advective environment in these regions. Errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature can lead to overestimation of component temperatures, significantly affecting the model's performance.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区使用双源能量平衡模型准确估计表面通量的挑战主要源于表面与空气温度差的的不确定性以及这些地区强烈的平流环境。从表面复合辐射温度中确定表层土壤和植被组分温度的误差可能导致组分温度的过高估计，显著影响模型的性能。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the difficulties in measuring evaporation and transpiration on the ground, especially in arid regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 是什么导致了在地面上测量蒸发和蒸腾的困难，尤其是在干旱地区？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The difficulties in measuring evaporation (E) and transpiration (T) on the ground, especially in arid regions, are caused by the limited effectiveness of current composite temperature separation approaches. In addition, errors in image classification can lead to uncertainties in estimating soil and canopy temperatures, which affects the accuracy of E and T measurements.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，测量蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）面临的困难主要是由于当前复合温度分离方法的有效性有限。此外，图像分类中的错误可能导致土壤和树冠温度估计的不确定性，从而影响E和T测量的准确性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential outcomes of using a multiscale dataset in capturing eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用多尺度数据集捕捉异质表面的生态水文过程的潜在结果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The use of a multiscale dataset can help address the challenge of poor availability of multiscale observations, allowing for a better understanding and capturing of multi-scale eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces. It might provide insights into oasis-desert interactions and enhance the understanding of water vapor, energy, and carbon exchanges within these systems, potentially supporting ecological stability and socioeconomic development.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用多尺度数据集可以帮助解决多尺度观测稀缺的问题，从而更好地理解和捕捉异质表面上的多尺度生态水文过程。它可能为绿洲-沙漠相互作用提供洞察，并增强对这些系统中水蒸气、能量和碳交换的理解，潜在地支持生态稳定和社会经济发展。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What consequences might arise from the inaccuracies in image classification when measuring soil and canopy component temperatures?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在测量土壤和树冠组件温度时，图像分类中的不准确性可能会导致哪些后果？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Inaccuracies in image classification can lead to errors in deriving component temperatures, such as soil pixels being misclassified as vegetation pixels. This misclassification can result in overestimation of canopy temperatures, affecting the TSEB model's performance and leading to uncertainties in estimating surface fluxes, such as latent heat fluxes, which are crucial for accurate evapotranspiration modeling.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 图像分类中的不准确性可能导致组件温度推导中的错误，例如土壤像素被错误分类为植被像素。这种错误分类可能导致冠层温度的高估，从而影响TSEB模型的性能，并导致在估算表面通量（如潜热通量）时的不确定性，这对准确的蒸散发建模至关重要。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What impact does the integration of multiple measurement systems, such as eddy covariance and thermal infrared cameras, have on the accuracy of evapotranspiration estimates?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 多个测量系统的集成，如涡度协方差法和热红外相机，对蒸散发估计的准确性有何影响？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating multiple measurement systems like eddy covariance systems and thermal infrared cameras can improve the accuracy of evapotranspiration estimates by providing robust soil and vegetation component temperature data. This integration helps in accurately separating soil and canopy latent heat fluxes, leading to reliable estimates of E/ET% and T/ET% ratios, even under challenging conditions such as strong advection in irrigated agricultural areas.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 整合多种测量系统，如涡度协方差系统和热红外相机，可以通过提供可靠的土壤和植被温度数据来提高蒸散发估算的准确性。这种整合有助于准确分离土壤和冠层的潜热通量，从而在强烈的平流条件下，尤其是在灌溉农业区域，仍能可靠地估算E/ET%和T/ET%比率。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the objectives behind implementing multiscale observations in eco-hydrological studies in arid regions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区的生态水文研究中实施多尺度观测的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objectives are to address the challenge of upscaling eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces by obtaining multiscale and multidisciplinary data through hierarchically nested instrumentation, as seen in the HiWATER experiment.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是通过层次嵌套的仪器获取多尺度和多学科的数据，以应对在异质表面上提升生态水文过程的挑战，正如HiWATER实验所示。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to maintain a balance between oasis and desert systems in the context of data collection for climate research?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在气候研究的数据收集中，保持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡是重要的原因是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: It is important because understanding the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is crucial for achieving carbon neutrality and supporting sustainable development, allowing for the protection of ecological stability and socioeconomic growth in these areas.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换非常重要，因为这对于实现碳中和和支持可持续发展至关重要，从而保护这些地区的生态稳定性和社会经济增长。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What specific instruments and procedural steps are involved in collecting multiscale eco-hydrological data in oasis-desert systems, and how is data quality ensured?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中收集多尺度生态水文数据涉及哪些具体仪器和程序步骤，以及如何确保数据质量？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The collection of multiscale eco-hydrological data in oasis-desert systems involves using a combination of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, and eco-hydrological sensor networks. Additionally, hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing tools such as LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, multi-angle thermal imagers, and L-band microwave radiometers are utilized. Quality control is maintained through sensor calibration, data collection, processing, and generation of datasets, ensuring careful calibration and validation of observational data.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，多尺度生态水文数据的收集涉及使用涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站和生态水文传感器网络的组合。此外，还利用超高分辨率的航空遥感工具，如激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计。通过传感器校准、数据收集、处理和数据集生成来保持质量控制，确保观测数据的仔细校准和验证。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are thermal images and ground-based measurements used to separate soil and canopy component temperatures, and what procedural steps are taken for validating these temperatures?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何使用热成像和地面测量来分离土壤和冠层成分温度，以及采取哪些程序步骤来验证这些温度？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Thermal images are obtained using a high-resolution thermal infrared camera, and these images are classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. The soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures are extracted from the thermal images. Thermal infrared temperatures are then converted to radiation temperatures using incoming long-wave radiation and emissivities. The simulated radiometric temperatures are validated against surface radiometric temperatures, calculated from incoming long-wave radiation observed by a four-component radiometer.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 热成像是通过高分辨率热红外相机获得的，这些图像使用最大似然法被分类为土壤和树冠像素。从热图像中提取土壤和树冠的方向亮度温度。然后，热红外温度通过入射的长波辐射和发射率转换为辐射温度。模拟的辐射温度与通过四分量辐射计观测到的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行验证。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedural challenges and data collection methods are associated with accurately estimating evapotranspiration (ET) in irrigated agricultural areas under strong advective conditions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在强烈的平流条件下，准确估计灌溉农业区域的蒸散发（ET）面临哪些程序性挑战和数据收集方法？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Accurately estimating ET in strongly advective conditions involves challenges such as errors in determining surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from composite radiometric temperature and the strong advective environment. Ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures are used, and high-resolution thermal cameras capture images to improve estimates. Eddy covariance systems are used to measure turbulent fluxes, and stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes are applied to validate E, T, and ET estimations. Ensuring accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures is crucial for the separation of E and T from ET using the TSEB model.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 在强对流条件下，准确估计蒸散发（ET）面临挑战，例如从复合辐射温度中确定表层土壤和植被组分温度的误差以及强对流环境。使用地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度，并通过高分辨率热成像相机捕捉图像以改善估计。涡度协方差系统用于测量湍流通量，稳定的氧和氢同位素被应用于验证蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散发（ET）的估算。确保准确的土壤和植被组分温度对于使用TSEB模型将E和T从ET中分离至关重要。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements have enabled the collection of multiscale and multidisciplinary data in oasis-desert systems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在绿洲-沙漠系统中能够收集多尺度和多学科的数据？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of hierarchically nested instrumentation, including eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing with LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, multi-angle thermal imagers, and L-band microwave radiometers, has enabled the collection of multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 层次嵌套的仪器使用，包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站以及高分辨率的航空遥感技术（如激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计），使得多尺度和多学科数据的收集成为可能。

Enablement.QuestionEn: In what ways does the deployment of eddy covariance systems and automatic meteorological stations enable long-term monitoring of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 涡度协方差系统和自动气象站的部署如何使得在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中对能量、水蒸气和碳交换的长期监测成为可能？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Eddy covariance systems and automatic meteorological stations allow for continuous, half-hourly measurements of turbulent fluxes and hydrometeorological data, facilitating long-term monitoring and analysis of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges across oasis-desert ecosystems.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统和自动气象站能够持续、每半小时测量湍流通量和水文气象数据，从而促进对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的长期监测和分析。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might data collection methods for eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface face challenges in obtaining multiscale observations?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的数据收集方法可能面临获取多尺度观测的挑战，原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations, which is a grand challenge when upscaling eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的制约，这是在异质表面上进行生态水文过程上尺度化时面临的重大挑战。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the anticipated difficulties in using ground-based measurements to accurately estimate surface fluxes in arid regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，使用地面测量准确估计表面通量时预期会遇到哪些困难？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is challenging, especially due to uncertainties in surface–air temperature differences and errors in determining component temperatures from composite radiometric temperatures.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是具有挑战性的，特别是由于表面与空气温度差异的不确定性以及从复合辐射温度中确定各组成部分温度的误差。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is it expected that long-term observations are critical for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 长期观测被认为对理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换至关重要，原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are indispensable for recognizing oasis–desert interactions and supporting the ecological security and sustainable development of oases, as they provide a quantitative understanding of these exchanges, which is crucial for maintaining balance in the ecosystem.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 长期观察对于识别绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展至关重要，因为它们提供了对这些交流的定量理解，这对于维持生态系统的平衡至关重要。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you evaluate the effectiveness of using thermal infrared cameras for measuring soil and canopy component temperatures in oasis-desert systems?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估在绿洲-沙漠系统中使用热红外相机测量土壤和冠层成分温度的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The use of thermal infrared cameras for measuring soil and canopy component temperatures in oasis-desert systems appears to be effective. The TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera can be applied in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas. This method has successfully separated the latent fluxes of soil and vegetation components with reasonable accuracy.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，使用热红外相机测量土壤和冠层成分温度似乎是有效的。利用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层成分辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈对流的灌溉农业区域。这种方法成功地以合理的精度分离了土壤和植被成分的潜热通量。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data collection methods for eco-hydrological processes can effectively capture multiscale observations in arid regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白生态水文过程的数据收集方法如何有效捕捉干旱地区的多尺度观测。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Several intensive observation periods and continuous hydrometeorological observations are conducted using a hierarchically nested scale with instruments covering different landscapes like sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland to capture multiscale eco-hydrological processes.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 进行多个密集观测期和连续的水文气象观测，采用分层嵌套的尺度，使用覆盖不同景观（如沙漠、沙砾石地、荒漠草原和湿地）的仪器，以捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the challenges faced when collecting long-term datasets for energy and water vapor exchanges in oasis-desert ecosystems.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中收集能量和水汽交换的长期数据集时面临的挑战感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Challenges include the need for a quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert areas, which is important for recognizing oasis-desert interactions and supporting ecological stability, especially under the threat of ecological degradation such as drying up of rivers and land desertification.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 挑战包括对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水蒸气和碳交换的定量理解，这对于认识绿洲-沙漠相互作用和支持生态稳定性至关重要，特别是在面临生态退化威胁的情况下，例如河流干涸和土地沙漠化。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how datasets for estimating evapotranspiration using the TSEB model are collected and validated.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解如何收集和验证用于估算蒸散发的TSEB模型的数据集。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Datasets for estimating evapotranspiration using the TSEB model involve collecting data such as soil and canopy component temperatures using a high-resolution thermal camera, and validating them against measurements from the EC system and stable isotope techniques, which help in separating and accurately estimating E, T, and ET.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 用于估算蒸散发的TSEB模型数据集涉及收集数据，例如使用高分辨率热像仪获取的土壤和冠层组件温度，并通过与EC系统和稳定同位素技术的测量进行验证，这有助于分离和准确估算蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散发（ET）。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore the various data collection methods used for hydrometeorological observations in oasis-desert systems and analyze their effectiveness.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨在绿洲-沙漠系统中用于水文气象观测的各种数据收集方法，并分析它们的有效性。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The methods include using a network of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, and a suite of sensors for soil moisture and leaf area index. These are complemented by hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer. These comprehensive methods allow for capturing multi-scale eco-hydrological processes, crucial for effective data collection in oasis-desert systems.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 这些方法包括使用涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站以及一系列土壤湿度和叶面积指数传感器。这些方法还辅以高分辨率的航空遥感技术，包括激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计。这些综合方法能够捕捉多尺度的生态水文过程，对于在绿洲-沙漠系统中有效的数据收集至关重要。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify and analyze the challenges faced in obtaining multi-scale observations for eco-hydrological processes in arid regions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别和分析在干旱地区获取生态水文过程的多尺度观测所面临的挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges include the poor availability of multiscale observations and the complexity of capturing data across heterogeneous surfaces. The implementation of a hierarchically nested observation system, as done in the HiWATER experiment, addresses this by arranging instruments at multiple scales and across diverse landscapes, including oasis and desert systems, to provide comprehensive data coverage.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 挑战包括多尺度观测的可用性差以及在异质表面上捕获数据的复杂性。通过实施分层嵌套的观测系统，如在HiWATER实验中所做的那样，安排在多个尺度和不同景观（包括绿洲和沙漠系统）上的仪器，以提供全面的数据覆盖。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please discuss potential strategies for developing datasets that effectively capture energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 讨论有效捕捉绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的潜在数据集开发策略。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential strategies include establishing long-term observational datasets comprising energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, supported by auxiliary hydrometeorological, vegetation, and soil data. Incorporating advanced remote sensing techniques and ensuring rigorous data processing and quality control can enhance dataset reliability. The datasets should be designed to capture the dynamics of oasis-desert interactions, facilitating sustainable development and ecological security.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 潜在的策略包括建立长期观测数据集，涵盖能量、水汽和碳通量，并辅以辅助的水文气象、植被和土壤数据。结合先进的遥感技术，并确保严格的数据处理和质量控制，可以提高数据集的可靠性。这些数据集应设计为捕捉绿洲-沙漠相互作用的动态，以促进可持续发展和生态安全。
